main event: A farmer in Mayville, Oregon sighted a cone-shaped light that changed between blue, red, and white colors over a 90-minute period on December 3, 1952.
interesting points: The object was first seen at an elevation of 19 degrees in the east and climbed to an elevation of 59 degrees before descending to 39 degrees in the southwest.
The object moved in an arc from east to southeast, covering a 39-degree horizontal arc in 12 minutes.
The observer was a 47-year-old farmer who held a commercial pilot's license and had served as a state legislator, indicating he was a reliable witness.
The object was initially described as having the same appearance as stars, but then changed to a cone-shaped light that changed colors.
sighted object: cone-shaped light that changed between blue, red, and white colors
